Chemistry.definition: Anything that has mass and occupies space.
The intermixing of particles of two different types of matter on their own.
The amount of heat energy required to change 1 kg of a solid into liquid at atmospheric pressure at its melting point.
A change of state directly from solid to gas without changing into liquid state.
A substance consisting of a single type of particle, where all constituent particles are the same in their chemical nature.
A basic form of matter that cannot be broken down into simpler substances by chemical reactions.
A substance composed of two or more elements, chemically combined with one another in a fixed proportion.
The smallest particle of an element that cannot usually exist independently and retains all its chemical properties.
A group of two or more atoms that are chemically bonded together; the smallest particle of an element or compound capable of independent existence.
The combining power (or capacity) of an element.
Atoms of the same element, having the same atomic number but different mass numbers.
Atoms of different elements with different atomic numbers, which have the same mass number.

Physics.definition: The shortest distance measured from the initial to the final position of an object.
The speed of an object moving in a definite direction.
The measure of the change in the velocity of an object per unit time. a = (v - u) / t
An object remains in a state of rest or of uniform motion in a straight line unless compelled to change that state by an applied force.
The natural tendency of an object to resist a change in its state of motion or of rest.
The product of an object's mass (m) and velocity (v). p = mv
The rate of change of momentum of an object is proportional to the applied unbalanced force in the direction of force. F = ma
To every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction, acting on two different objects simultaneously.
The force acting on an object perpendicular to the surface.
The thrust acting per unit area. Pressure = Thrust / Area
When a body is immersed fully or partially in a fluid, it experiences an upward force that is equal to the weight of the fluid displaced by it.
The product of the force and displacement in the direction of the force. W = Fs
The energy possessed by an object due to its motion. Ek = ½mv²
The energy possessed by an object by virtue of its position or configuration. Ep = mgh
The rate of doing work or the rate of transfer of energy. P = W / t

Biology.definition: The fundamental structural and functional unit of living organisms.
The selectively permeable outermost covering of the cell that regulates the entry and exit of materials.
The movement of water molecules through a selectively permeable membrane toward a higher solute concentration.
The control center of the cell containing chromosomes and DNA (genetic information).
Organisms whose cells lack a nuclear membrane (e.g., bacteria).
Organisms with cells that have a nuclear membrane and membrane-enclosed organelles.
A group of cells that are similar in structure and work together to achieve a particular function.
The dividing tissue in plants located only in certain specific regions of growth.
Complex permanent tissue in plants that transports water and minerals vertically.
Complex permanent tissue in plants that transports food from leaves to other parts.
The unit of nervous tissue, highly specialised for transmitting stimuli rapidly within the body.
The process of cell division for growth, producing two identical daughter cells.
The process of cell division for forming gametes, producing four new cells with half the number of chromosomes.
